MPEG TS Documentation¶

MPEGTS Class¶

class MPEGTS.MPEGTS¶

This class handles MPEG Transport Streams. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MPEG_transport_stream

Each transport stream contains 188 byte packets. These packets contain either video, audio or metadata information

FirstCount()¶

Get the value of the first continuity counter

Return type:int
LastCount()¶

Get the value of the final continuity counter

Return type:int
NumberOfBlocks()¶

How many MPEG blocks in the current TS

Return type:int
unpack(buf)¶

This method will convert a buffer of bytes into an array of MPEG TS packets

Parameters:buf (str) – The buffer to unpack
Return type:bool
blocks = None¶

List of MPEGPacket objects

MPEGPacket Class¶

class MPEGTS.MPEGPacket¶

The MPEGPacket is the elementary unit in an MPEG Transport Stream It contains an header, in which there’s a sync word, continuity counter, and a payload

unpack(buf)¶

Converts a buffer into an MPEGTS packet

Parameters:buf (str) – The buffer to unpack into an MPEG Packet
Return type:bool

H264 Class¶

class MPEGTS.H264¶

This class will handle H.264 payload. It can convert a buffer of bytes into an array of NALs(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_Abstraction_Layer) The NALs contain different data, based on their types.

unpack(buf)¶

Split the buffer into multiple NALs and store as a H264 object

Parameters:buf (str) – The buffer to unpack into a H264 object
Return type:bool

NAL Class¶

class MPEGTS.NAL¶

The NAL can be split into the various types of NALs.

unpack(buf)¶

Split the buffer into a NAL object

Parameters:buf (str) – The buffer to unpack into an NAL
Return type:bool

STANAG4609_SEI Class¶

class MPEGTS.STANAG4609_SEI¶

Handle the SEI NAL and more specifically this will handle SEIs defined in 3.14.3.5 of the STANAG standard http://www.gwg.nga.mil/misb/docs/nato_docs/STANAG_4609_Ed3.pdf

unpack(buf)¶

Unpack the NAL payload as an STANAG4609_SEI

Parameters:buf (str) – The buffer to unpack into an STANAG4609_SEI
Return type:bool
